Comment.value: if arch is in waiting mode

value.0: "Should I follow you now?"
"As you wish."
"I will do so. Let's hurry."

Comment.value: if arch is in follow mode

value.0: "Yes? We need to keep going. We don't want the enemy to discover the information before we do."
"As I said. Let's go."
"Oh, leave me alone. I'm not slowing you down that much."
"Really? Let me see that. Ah... that explains much, doesn't it! And yet it leaves so many questions."
"What caused the undead to rise again? What are the two triggers? Where did the armies go? Perhaps we shall discover more when we find this orb he spoke of."
"I hate to waste the time, but I suppose you know what you're doing."
This unusually intense man walks towards you, quickly gauging you with a look. "I hope your presence here means that someone in the keep is finally taking me seriously."
"Good enough. The Stan has always been a reliable source of assistance. After what I saw about an hour ago, I'll need all the assistance I can get."
"True enough, but I believe that the current problems in the keep might be linked to my studies here. Um... who are you exactly?"
Ohio chuckles. "I like your sense of humor. You're going to need it when I tell you what I saw about an hour ago."
"Good, because I strongly believe that my research here might have a direct link to the problems the keep is currently experiencing. Um... who are you exactly?"
"That is a very long name, <FullName>, soon to be <Lord/Lady> of the Keep. I think I'll just call you <FirstName>. I guess I'd better tell you what happened about an hour ago."
"I was hiding, waiting for some help to come along, when I heard someone speaking in a harsh, guttural language. I recognized the goblin tongue, but some of the words were strange."
"Then I saw a dark-skinned elf and I knew I was in trouble."

"It seemed to be in charge of a large group of goblins, making me think that it is probably a general of some sort in the Masked Man's army. They went into the caves, lending weight to my theory of a link."
"I suspect they are searching for the same information I am. We need to get in there and make sure they don't get it."
"All right, I suppose it is important for you to know what you are getting into. I believe that when the former lord and his army disappeared, they went to another plane of reality."
"I think that this ruin and the keep were linked at one time, as magical keys for performing a very powerful and very dangerous magic."
"Recently I discovered a journal kept by the advisor to our former lord. The journal detailed his research into the magical properties of the keep."
"Well, if you wish to merely take me into the ruins and keep me alive, then no. If you want to know what might be in our way, and why we are here in the first place, then yes."
"As you wish. The ruins are full of undead, plus the goblins and the drow. They haven't returned since they entered. Let's get going."
"I don't know much more than the adviser's ruminations on the possibility of opening a portal to another world and access to an army of undead."
"The problem is that the journal I found was full, and it didn't complete the story. I think there was probably a later journal that the advisor had on him."
"Whatever else he discovered, no one knows. The advisor disappeared the day before the new lord and his army left the keep. I think he may have come here."
"Right. I'm as ready as I'll ever be. I'll follow your lead."
"No. I imagine it will cost him a few goblins to get past the undead, if they are able to get past them at all. I wonder how the old advisor managed to get past them?"
"He never said anything about the undead being in the ruins. Perhaps something happened since that time? Fascinating stuff."
"There must be something in these ruins that the advisor was getting his information from. I suspect there must be some kind of magical guide to the information we seek."
"Well, keep in mind that this is mostly supposition based on one man's magical research and it might not be highly accurate."
"Of course, but we should hurry. We don't want the forces of the Masked Man to gain any advantage over us."
"Little is known, except that it is a place of vast power and not a single living soul. What would happen to someone who entered the plane and was trapped there?"
"So few answers, so many questions. Hopefully we will discover more inside."
"The mages of an ancient empire that used to rule this continent tapped into an ancient, dead world. They were able to harness the powers of this world to draw the armies into this one."
"What happened to that world... nobody knows. Certainly the advisor warned his lord that such powers must be used with extreme care, a warning that must have fallen on deaf ears."
"That is one of the answers I seek in these ruins. If the advisor was right, there should be some way to control the armies from this plane."
"The journal suggested that it was a private army of an ancient empire. The empire used it to take control of this entire continent, according to some hieroglyphics the advisor found."
"If this army still exists, it would probably be quite large. The mages of the empire would take the dead of those conquered and add them to their army."

Comment.value: when arch enters puzzle room he should speak this as either a pop up, or initiate dialogue and say it.

value.0: Ohio Smith looks at the jars, the chest and then the door. "Well, this is interesting. I assume there is some kind of magical puzzle to get through the door. Fascinating."

Comment.value: when arch enters room with orb.

value.0: Ohio Smith looks at the broken orb and sighs, "That is truly unfortunate. What a magnificent find this would have been had the orb been intact."
"Still, there is plenty here for me to research, and it is possible that I might find more clues to the disappearance of our former lord's army."
"Thank you for your assistance, <FirstName>. I will contact The Stan and make sure he pays you. Good luck in the election, though why anyone would want the hassle of running a keep, I have no idea."
"The engravings in this room are fascinating. I have learned much about the culture that built the ruins, though not much that would be handy to you."
"All I know so far is that these people really worshipped death. Fascinating!"
"Wait a little longer."
"Follow me."
"Let's keep going."
"You're slowing me down. Hurry up!"

Comment.value: if pc has journal of king's adviser

value.0: "I found this journal."

Comment.value: arch follows you to final room and stays there

value.0: "I need you to wait here."

Comment.value: Ohio will stop and wait here.

value.0: "The Stan sent me. I am <FullName>."
"With all the troubles the keep has been having, you're lucky anyone noticed you at all."
"I am Person-Who-Keeps-You-Alive, but you may call me <FirstName>."
"I take everything seriously."
"I am <FullName>, soon to be <Lord/Lady> of the Keep."
"Where is this creature now?"
"Why? What's so frightening about a dark-elf?"
"There was a drow here?"
"Why would the enemy be seeking this information?"
"What exactly are we looking for?"
"You had better tell me about your research."
"Do I really need to know about this?"
"Then let's just get going."
"Then continue."
"So this could be dangerous to us?"
"What kind of magic are we talking about here?"
"We had better get going."
"Have you seen the drow since he entered?"
"What are we looking for then?"
"I have questions about this undead army."
"Let's talk about something else."
"What do you know about this other plane?"
"Who made the army?"
"Who controls this army?"
"How large is this army?"

Comment.value: give xp 500, set archeologist to finished dialogue.
